meanings.definition: Intense, typically intermittent pain along the course of a nerve.
meanings.sent1: The neuralgia pain shot through her arm like a lightning bolt.
meanings.sent2: She winced as the neuralgia sensation pulsed down her leg.
meanings.sent3: The neuralgia in his back made him walk like a robot trying to dance.
meanings.sent4: The neuralgia in her jaw felt like tiny daggers stabbing at her.
meanings.sent5: The neuralgia pain was so sharp, it felt like tiny needles poking her skin.

meanings.definition: A condition characterized by severe pain along the course of a nerve.
meanings.sent1: Her neuralgia made it hard to focus on anything but the pain.
meanings.sent2: The doctor diagnosed her with neuralgia after the persistent nerve pain.
meanings.sent3: His neuralgia acted up whenever he heard a bad joke, making him laugh and wince at the same time.
meanings.sent4: The neuralgia in her foot was like a constant reminder of her injury.
meanings.sent5: The neuralgia in his shoulder felt like a heavy weight dragging him down.
